title: Improve rustdoc's Trait Implementations section by grouping by module

labels.name: T-rustdoc
labels.description: Relevant to the rustdoc team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: C-enhancement
labels.description: Category: An issue proposing an enhancement or a PR with one.

body:
Right now, rustdoc's output for `std::option::Option` looks like this (as seen on https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/option/enum.Option.html):

![current](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/831192/31552056-6033b71c-b004-11e7-8c0f-02fa0818671b.PNG)

This is pretty hard for me to read. I think this has been suggested before but hiding (or at least, minimizing) the trait methods makes this much easier to read:

![better](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/831192/31552157-a2106842-b004-11e7-995d-c6bc307e8a78.PNG)

This better but it's still hard to skim through because there's no ordering to the results (at least, that I can discern). If the trait impls were grouped by module, it would be much easier to skim:

![even better](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/831192/31552261-f6a9a59e-b004-11e7-9462-09861eddc4d7.PNG)

Alphabetizing the modules and the trait impls would improve this even more.
